Science can already detect everything a human can, and much, much more. We can detect temperature changes to a tiny percentage of a degree, even remotely. We can detect movement in light spectrum much wider than the human eye can pick up. We can detect electromagnetic waves in a massive range of frequencies with such accuracy we can use the tools on stars hundreds of light years away. We can detect sound down well below the threshold of human hearing, as well as other vibrations. We can detect pressure with incredibly accuracy, radiation even down to a single decaying particle and much much more. We can build instruments that operate 24/7 - always alert; never tired, confused or surprised, and with 100% accurate memory, unlike humans. People have spent months and years setting up these instruments in places claimed to be haunted, trying to detect ghosts, with no definitive results. Any results found could not be repeated, and if it cannot be repeated, it is not science (generally, this means something was wrong with the experiment). Hundreds of spirit mediums have been encourage to summon spirits while being recorded. Nothing of note was found. There’s three possibilities: Ghosts do not affect any instrument we are using. This seems unrealistic, as most claims of ghosts include movement, temperature changes and similar, which we could absolutely pick up.Ghosts are intelligent enough to spot the instruments - even hidden ones - and avoid them. If ghosts are meant to be deceased humans, this is also unlikely, as there is a lot of variability in intelligence, and one, somewhere, would mess up. Not to mention, with mobile phones we have reasonably accurate instruments everywhere.Ghosts do not exist. They are an artefact of human senses and memory, which are both easily distorted, given how powerful our imaginations are, and how poor some of our senses are.

Had the existence of ghosts been proven by science? Not in the literal sense as in dead people walking about, but I believe science has explained ghosts as misfirings of the cognitive stystem. Now I don’t believe in ghosts, but I have done ghost hunts because I wanted to understand why people do believe in them. So I was put in a room with a woman to sit fir an hour and record anything we heard or saw. We were both facing into the same room, I had windows behind me that I could see out of and see the footway along side the road. But we saw and heard very different things that night She heard and saw ghost children playing hopscotch in front of her between me and her, the children were laughing and joking like children do, she was absolutely convinced at what she had seen and heard. What I saw and heard, despite looking at the same piece of floor was very different, the woman was infront of me the other side of the piece of floor the children were playing on. I heard children laughing and joking too, but they were behind me, outside, when I turned I could see the children outside, real children, with their mother who was pushing a pram, thet were messing about as young children do. The woman told me what she had seen and the time she had seem it, I told her what I had seem at the same time, despite this, she refused to accept that what I saw accounted for the children’s voices she had heard, she just responded with “I know what I saw!”. The human mind is very good at playing tricks and filling the gaps. On a ghost hunt you want to see ghosts, you hear voices, with no other information your mind can fill the gaps and you might “see” those children, even though it was clear those were real children outside. I believe that all ghost sightings are very complex hallucinations which can affect all the senses such that people can see, hear, feel, touch and smell these hallucinations, not real things, remember that everything we see hear and touch is just electrical signals, there is no reason why we can’t have these signals without the corresponding stimuli. I have seem many other examples if this where the desire to believe or the natural susceptibility of a person to believe can have a marked effect on thier perception and understanding of external stimuli. Incidentally I have never seen a ghost, not even the ones that the people I was with saw.

I've long had an interest in ghosts. My sisters have had encounters.  One, as a child, saw a woman in Victorian clothing at my grandmother's very old flat in San Francisco.  She returned from the hallway asking the grownups who was that lady in the hall. The other was spending the night at our folk's place.  She woke from her sleep hearing what sounded like someone trying to unlock the bedroom door.  You may be familiar with the phony bedroom doorknob locks that can be popped open with a butter knife or flathead screwdriver.  Thinking it was our Mom, she called out.  No answer.  Anyways, the door opened and she could hear the bottom edge of the door rubbing across the nap of the rug.  She quickly took one step out of bed to turn on the overhead light and climbed back into bed.  There she sat trying to figure out what just happened.  Suddenly she heard, what she describes as "a man's footsteps" pacing at the foot of her bed.  That's when she got the hell outta of the room and, as she made her way to our folk's downstairs bedroom, she turned on EVERY hallway light, including a 50+ overhead entry light.  My Dad is a stickler for turning off lights, but my sister's story was so convincing all those lights burned all night long. One time, my mom woke up with a bad feeling.  The following morning my Dad learned his good friend had died. I've never had such direct contact, but while at my folk's home, I've seen things in the corner of my eye, which was so convincing that I turned my head expecting to see someone.  That, I've heard, is how most people see ghosts. Come to think of it, I have a buddy who would see movement out of the corner of his eye after his cat of 15+ years had died. I believe in science.  But there are some things that science still can't explain, such as how gravity works.  But, just because science can't explain it doesn't mean that gravity doesn't exist. There are just too many people that have claimed to have seen ghosts to dismiss the existence of ghosts so easily. When I retire, I plan to entertain myself with ghost hunting.  I probably should wear adult diapers, because I am easily frightened.  Oh, well.

After quick googling I found two interesting stories by researchers. Story 1 (Ghost in the fan): In a 1998 paper on natural causes of hauntings [PDF], engineer Vic Tandy describes working for a medical equipment manufacturer, whose labs included a reportedly haunted room. Whenever Tandy worked in this particular lab, he felt depressed and uncomfortable, often hearing and seeing odd things—including an apparition that definitely looked like a ghost. Eventually, he discovered that the room was home to an 19 Hz standing wave coming from a fan, which was sending out the inaudible vibrations that caused the disorienting effects. Further studies also show links between infrasound and bizarre sensations like getting chills down the spine or feeling uneasy. Ghost in this story 19 Hz standing wave coming from fan. Infra-sound precisely. Story 2 (Ghost in the furnance) : In 1921, a doctor named W.H. Wilmer published an odd story about a haunted house in the medical journal the AmericanJournal of Ophthalmology. The family who lived in this haunted residence, called the H family in the medical literature, began experiencing weird phenomena when they moved into an old house—hearing furniture moving around and strange voices in the night, feeling the presence of invisible specters. They report being held down in bed by ghosts, feeling weak, and more. As it turned out, a faulty furnace was filling their house with carbon monoxide, causing aural and visual hallucinations. The furnace was fixed, and the H family went back to their lives, sans ghosts. Deadly ghost carbon-monoxide. Have you ever tried magic mushrooms? Oh don’t try, they contain a strong drug which causes hallucinations. If you are lucky you enjoy the trip else pray the god :D Likewise these mushrooms there are toxic gases produced by toxic molds can cause bad hallucinations. It is found that different kinds of toxic molds were grown at several haunted places. It is very hard to simulate the haunted places or haunted scenes to reproduce in a science lab to prove that ghosts don't really exists. PS: Different answers had already said these things. I only provided proven examples from internet.

They’re 100% tricks of the mind or environmentally caused. Most “ghost encounters” (as well as most “alien encounters”) happen during periods of sleep or drowsiness, and there’s a good reason for that. About 30% of people are prone to periods of “sleep paralysis”, where the person wakes up but is stuck in the same mental state as a period of REM sleep; you’re stuck in a dream but you can’t move, as your voluntary control over your body is turned off (or greatly diminished) during REM sleep, and if you were awakened by a nightmare, guess what? You’re now in a living nightmare. This is why, when I hear somebody discussing a haunting, the first thing I start probing for is, “When do these spirits show up?” I don’t think I’ve ever had a report that doesn’t somehow involve laying in bed or watching TV late at night. I mentioned “environmentally caused” because a lot of hauntings involve random sounds throughout a house. I’ve mentioned before that one house, haunted by spirits that would walk around the upstairs at random times during the day, was actually being caused by a loose hot water pipe, so the “random times” just happened to be “when the hot water was being used”. I also read a report of ghostly knockings being caused by people climbing up the fire escape outside. I have yet to experience anything observable that wasn’t easily explained or even remedied. So, ghosts, simply put, don’t exist, per the realm of science. This doesn’t mean that they’ve been proven not to exist, just that all hauntings can be explained rationally.

I should begin by saying that “scientific evidence” is probably the wrong place to begin answering your real or not real question. The basic scientific method is important, but it must be applied with an open mind. Many of us make a distinction between mainstream science and frontier science. Mainstream science is really good for the study of commonly accepted principles. But, the institutions supporting established science has a vested interest in being right. As of today, being right means that there is no such thing as nonphysical anything. With that said, the four conditions of my answer are that: There is a nonphysical aspect of reality. In the survival metaphysics I study, the physical is a product of consciousness, but there is a less complex model that is better supported by current study. That is, a subtle field of influence permeates the physical, sometimes referred to as the Psi Field. Important characteristics of the field are that it is nonlocal (no distance; everywhere is here) and that it acts as a medium of propagation for consciousness and thought.Mind is not the body. That is, our conscious self existed before this lifetime and will exist after this lifetime in a sentient form.People are naturally psychic in that they sense information in the Psi Field and express psi as information and influence (psychokinesis).Discarnate personalities (aka loved ones; supposedly dead people) are able to communicate with people still in the flesh by way of mind-to-mind psi expressions and psychokinetic influence on physical processes. (Electronic Voice Phenomena (EVP) for instance).These four conditions must be true for ghosts to be real. Realistically, “proof” is still being developed as research continues. Anomalous access of information (psychic functioning, mediumship) and mental influence of physical processes (EVP and changes of randomness of random processes) represent areas of research that tend to support Items 1–3. Item 4 is the most difficult to “prove.” The fact that people are able to psychically access information that appears to be present in the minds of still living people makes it difficult to say that a reported contact from a discarnate loved one did not actually come from someone's memory of the person. There is also the problem that we know of no way to shield from psi influence. Put another way, the information a psychic accesses could come from any place in the world, including a sealed vault or from a person deep in a mine on the other side of the world. The only psychically accessed information we might be able to say probably comes from a discarnate person is if the information is not known by anyone in the world. If the information is in the form of “That is something long-dead Uncle John might have said,” it is arguable that something came from the mind of someone who knew Uncle John. An EVP recorded by Martha Copeland is an example of information that no one in the physical knew of at the time. You can hear it at Martha Copeland EVP on the Association TransCommunication website. So, while the four conditions above might be satisfied, there remains the human factor of the witness and the form the ghost takes. The best of the study and research seems to tell us that physical phenomena may be caused by a different personality, but must go through the witness. This appears to be the case for EVP, for instance. This is to say that we are the channel and we tend to color what we channel based on our expectations. If this is true, ghosts are not physically present. They are superimposed over the scene in our mind’s eye. Ghostly physical effects are probably of the same sort of psychokinetic effects as we see in poltergeist phenomena. All of the (probably) required elements seem to be in place for ghosts to be real. They may not be proof of a discarnate personality. Much of what is popularly believed about ghosts is folklore.

Well, ghosts have been filmed, photographed and recorded ever since the technologies have been available.  They have been witnessed by people in every strata of every society everywhere on earth dating back to the beginning of written records.  There is no culture that does not know what a ghost is.  That is a legitimate form of evidence.  No explanation other than "ghosts exist" provides a satisfactory answer.  No one has ever shown that any other explanation, including all skeptical ones are supported by data that takes everything into account.  And if you don't do that, you don't have a satisfactory answer.  So "ghosts exist" remains the only answer that can explain all the evidence. Taken as a whole, you'd have to be pretty arrogant to assume that every documentation is a fake and every person is either fooling themselves or a fraud.  You can't just declare that, you have to demonstrate scientifically how that can account for everything.  That has never been done and it's doubtful it can be. A scientific explanation for their existence?  That's rather easy.  They're conscious entities without bodies, which means that consciousness cannot be created or destroyed, which makes consciousness part of physics.  If you know anything about quantum physics, then you know that's not much of a stretch.

Just imagine for a moment that ghosts are real, and we can communicate with them. Let's assume also that they can communicate with each other, since that seems to be part of the standard lore about ghosts. That means that ghosts could tell us every single hidden secret from the past. They could tell us where treasure is buried, and what happened to the Marie Celeste. They could tell us who invented fire and the wheel. They could give detailed reconstructions of important battles and other historical events. They could fill in details about the real lives of Christ and Mohammed, and other seminal figures in history. They could give us fantastically useful and important information about many, many things. Creatures from another dimension? Well, they might not know this stuff, but there would be a ton of other vital and fascinating bits of information they could tell us. Now, let's look at the facts and see what alleged ghosts actually do give us:  Moaning soundsCold chillsRattling soundsBloodstained wallsDo you see the enormous discrepancy here between the incredible claims that are being made and the pathetic feebleness of the evidence being put forward to back up those claims? Whatever ghosts are -- and in my view they are the product of human feeblemindedness and eagerness to deceive -- they're clearly not important or useful enough for humans to bother with right now. If and when they can tell us something of value, then we can reconsider -- but I won't hold my breath.

Funny thing is, I used to be a skeptic, but just an ignorant one!

Supposedly supernatural, paranormal things like ghosts, demons, spirits, souls, devils, angels, etc., are not objectively real. As of this point in time nobody has been able to manifest or “conjure” any such entity under strict laboratory settings so that it could be reliable, repeatedly tested, measured and validated by independent researchers as being objectively real. The scientific method is real, and it’s how we can determine the nature of the world around us and understand how it works. So far, science hasn’t validated that supernatural entities or powers are objectively real. The supernatural only appears to exist subjectively, within an individual’s own mind and imagination.

A scientific explanation for ghosts would probably be different for each scenario, and generally impossible given limited second or third hand information. Generally speaking though, I would say it's usually either a natural illusion or someone trying to take advantage of someone else's superstitions.   The easiest explanation for the belief in ghosts is that people interpret their experiences in whatever way fits with what they already believe.  A very large percentage of people believe in some form of an afterlife, which in turns means that they believe in some sort of non-mortal soul that is separate from the body.  With such a prevalence, I find it entirely logical that many people would interpret "unexplained phenomena" to be attributable to "ghosts."   Now what is interesting to me is that most religions don't actually say that there could be ghosts lingering around our world.  Usually, the afterlife is somewhere completely separate from here.  Yet, simply the thought of an afterlife gives people the license to believe in a sort of generic possibility of ghosts or spirits without having to explain how or why they could be present. Along with that is our own fear of mortality and wanting to live on, or wanting our loved ones to still be with us somehow, or people just liking the feeling of being scared.

we are obsesed with objective sciens but ghosts can only be seen using subjective science. For the last three hundred years or so, the world has been dominated by one type of science; objective science. This means the study of objects outside of the individual, hence objective – of the object. Objective science is great because you can conduct experiments or observations that can prove things, and you can repeat these so that others can see the efficacy of the findings. Biology, Chemistry and Physics are all objective sciences, and they have achieved so much. Before this time, for a period of many centuries, science was a mixture of superstition, local traditions and fear induced beliefs. If you go back further, thousands and thousands of years, mainly in Asian countries, there was another kind of science called subjective science. This is the scientific study of the subject – yourself. These days subjectivity is described as something negative and, compared with the evidence and proof of objective science you can see why. But you cannot study subjectivity in an objective way. How can the part study the whole? A man cannot dissect himself and if he did he wouldn’t be alive to report the findings. In any case what he is searching for does not have a physical existence whether it is the mind or the heart centre. The first thing that you have to remember when undertaking a subjective experiment is to question whether it is your imagination that has made up the solution or whether it is indeed a subjective truth – a truth about your own past. This is remarkably difficult to explain but not so difficult to experience. And, of course, the experience can only be in the individual concerned. The experience cannot be shared because it is subjective. That’s why some of the old saints have said that they can indicate the path but you have to walk on it yourself. Subjectivity is something that can only be experienced first hand.

When a man dies, he is called dead, but when he again appears in a subtle form not visible to our present vision and yet acts, such a dead body is called a ghost. Ghosts are always very bad elements, always creating a fearful situation for others. It is practically experienced. I know that the ghost, if you go in a house ghostly haunted, if you chant Hare Krsna mantra, they’ll go away. They cannot tolerate. In my life there was several incidences like that. In my household life, I was doing business in Lucknow. So there was one house, very big house, worth thousands of rupees’ rent, but it was ghostly haunted. So nobody would take that house. I took it at two hundred rupees, (laughter) and very big house. And I was… All the servants, they complained, “Sir, there is ghost.” So I was chanting. He was living in several spots, especially on the gate side. So I could understand, but I would chant Hare Krsna, and I was saved. Everyone was saved. There was… And, say, in 1969 I was guest in the house of John Lennon in London. So there was a ghost in… It was a big plot. There was a guest house. So they complained, “Sir, here is ghost.” So I advised them to chant Hare Krsna, and the ghost went away. Yes. This is fact. When there is Hare Krsna chanting, these ghostly, demonic living entities, they’ll not be able to stay there. They’ll go away. [750203BG.HAW] Those who are very sinful and attached to their family, house, village or country do not receive a gross body made of material elements but remain in a subtle body, composed of mind, ego and intelligence. Those who live in such subtle bodies are called ghosts. This ghostly position is very painful because a ghost has intelligence, mind and ego and wants to enjoy material life, but because he doesn’t have a gross material body, he can only create disturbances for want of material satisfaction. It is the duty of family members, especially the son, to offer oblations to the demigod Aryama or to Lord Visnu. From time immemorial in India the son of a dead man goes to Gaya and, at a Visnu temple there, offers oblations for the benefit of his ghostly father. It is not that everyone’s father becomes a ghost, but the oblations of pinda are offered to the lotus feet of Lord Visnu so that if a family member happens to become a ghost, he will be favored with a gross body. However, if one is habituated to taking the prasada of Lord Visnu, there is no chance of his becoming a ghost or anything lower than a human being. In Vedic civilization there is a performance called sraddha by which food is offered with faith and devotion. If one offers oblations with faith and devotion–either to the lotus feet of Lord Visnu or to His representative in Pitrloka, Aryama–one’s forefathers will attain material bodies to enjoy whatever material enjoyment is due them. In other words, they do not have to become ghosts. [SB 4.18.18] The word eka-pada, “one-legged,” refers to ghosts, for it is said that ghosts walk on one leg. [SB 4.29.2] Because of his desire to enjoy the material world, the living entity is dressed with the material gross and subtle bodies. Thus he is given a chance to enjoy the senses. The senses are therefore the instruments for enjoying the material world; consequently the senses have been described as friends. Sometimes, because of too much sinful activity, the living entity does not get a material gross body, but hovers on the subtle platform. This is called ghostly life. Because of his not possessing a gross body, he creates a great deal of trouble in his subtle body. Thus the presence of a ghost is horrible for those who are living in the gross body. [SB 4.29.6] Sometimes the living entity is forced to give up his body and enter another one according to the judgment of Yamaraja. It is difficult, however, for the conditioned soul to enter another body unless the present dead body is annihilated through cremation or some other means. The living being has attachment for the present body and does not want to enter another, and thus in the interim he remains a ghost. If a living being who has already left his body has been pious, Yamaraja, just to give him relief, will give him another body. Since the living being in the body of the King had some attachment to his body, he was hovering as a ghost, and therefore Yamaraja, as a special consideration, approached the lamenting relatives to instruct them personally. Yamaraja approached them as a child because a child is not restricted but is granted admittance anywhere, even to the palace of a king. Besides this, the child was speaking philosophy. People are very much interested in hearing philosophy when it is spoken by a child. [SB 7.2.36] After giving up the body, one is transferred to another body, but sometimes, if one is too sinful, he is checked from transmigrating to another body, and thus he becomes a ghost. To save a diseased person from ghostly life, the funeral ceremony, or sraddha ceremony, as prescribed in authorized sastra, must be performed. Ravana was killed by Lord Ramacandra and was destined for hellish life, but by Lord Ramacandra’s advice, Vibhisana, Ravana’s brother, performed all the duties prescribed in relation to the dead. Thus Lord Ramacandra was kind to Ravana even after Ravana’s death. [SB 9.10.29] We have heard of people’s being haunted by ghosts. Having no gross material body, a ghost seeks shelter of a gross body to stay in and haunt. The Sakatasura was a ghost who had taken shelter of the handcart and was looking for the opportunity to do mischief to Krsna. When Krsna kicked the cart with His small and very delicate legs, the ghost was immediately pushed down to the earth and his shelter dismantled, as already described. This was possible for Krsna because He has full potency. [SB 10.7.9] If a man becomes disappointed and he cuts his own throat or hangs himself, some way or other, eats some poison, to finish, does it mean that he is finished? Na hanyate hanyamane sarire. He is rascal. He does not know. By finishing this body he is finished–no, that is not possible. The result is, because he violated the rules of nature, he becomes a ghost. That is his life. One who commits suicide, he becomes a ghost. Ghost means he does not get this material body. He remains in the subtle body, mind, intelligence. Therefore ghost can go because he is in the mind. Mind speed is very strong. If you have got this material body, you cannot go immediately hundred miles off. But if you are in the mental body, you can go immediately, thousand miles immediately, within a second. So the ghost, they can play something wonderful because… But they are not happy because they have no gross body. They want to enjoy. He’s materialist. He has committed suicide for some material want. So he is want of material…, fulfilling material desire. He could not fulfill in this body; therefore commits suicide, but the desire is there. The desire is there, and he cannot fulfill it. He becomes perplexed. Therefore the ghost create disturbance sometimes.
